metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3867 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
[ksmbd: add missing compound request handing in some commands] It was discovered that the KSMBD implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly handle session setup requests, leading to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. A remote attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3867` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic-64k - 6.5.0-5.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency - 6.5.0-5.5.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-5.5.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-oracle - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-raspi - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required

No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> also known as ZDI-23-981, ZDI-CAN-21355 needs ksmbd-tools installed to enable the service, which is not installed by default.
